bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. HERRERA BEUTLER:H.R. 1012.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress is required by Article I, Section 6, of theConstitution to determine its own pay. This legislation isalso consistent with the Twenty-Seventh Amendment of theConstitution.[Page H1726]

item.title: To provide for a 10 percent reduction in pay for Members of Congress, to make Federal civilian employees subject to a period of mandatory unpaid leave, to reduce appropriations for salaries and expenses for offices of the legislative branch during fiscal year 2012, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Commercial and Administrative Law.

item.title: To provide for a 10 percent reduction in pay for Members of Congress.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy .

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy.

Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, and in addition to the Committee on House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management
Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

summary.text:
Savings Start With Us Act of 2011 - Reduces the annual rate of pay in 2013 for Members of Congress and the Vice President by 10% of the 2011 pay rate. Maintains the pay rate for subsequent pay periods at the 2013 rate.

Reduces the annual rate of pay of the President from $400,000 to $360,000.

bill.title: Savings Start With Us Act of 2011

item.title: Savings Start With Us Act of 2011
To provide for a 10 percent reduction in pay for Members of Congress, the President, and the Vice President.
Savings Start With Us Act of 2011

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
